intro: Caltha andicola, commonly known as the Andean buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant features bright yellow flowers with numerous stamens, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often covered in a fine, velvety texture. Caltha andicola thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to the harsh conditions of mountainous regions.
